rocks.bastion.core

Class CommonRequestAttributes

  • java.lang.Object
    • rocks.bastion.core.CommonRequestAttributes

  • public class CommonRequestAttributes
extends Object

    Contains the common attributes which usually appear in all HTTP requests. This class is intended to be used as an object inside implementations of HttpRequest. Using inheritance by composition, we avoid repeating the handling for HTTP headers, query parameters and route parameters.

    While not being an HttpRequest, this class provides methods which are similar to those found in that interface so that classes which use the CommonRequestAttributes can delegate the HttpRequest implementing methods to this object.

    Author:
    Kyle

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String EMPTY_BODY
      Represents an empty HTTP content body.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CommonRequestAttributes(HttpMethod method, String url, Object body)
      Constructs a new instance of this object containing the following initial defaults: HTTP method: Supplied as an argument this this constructor. URL: Supplied as an argument this this constructor. Name: Initialised to be the HTTP method concatenated with the URL. Content-type: Initialised to the value of ContentType.TEXT_PLAIN. Headers: Initialised to the empty collection of headers. Query parameters: Initialised to the empty collection of query parameters. Route parameters: Initialised to the empty collection of route parameters.

        public static final String EMPTY_BODY

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommonRequestAttributes

        public CommonRequestAttributes(HttpMethod method,
                               String url,
                               Object body)
        Constructs a new instance of this object containing the following initial defaults:
        • HTTP method: Supplied as an argument this this constructor.
        • URL: Supplied as an argument this this constructor.
        • Name: Initialised to be the HTTP method concatenated with the URL.
        • Content-type: Initialised to the value of ContentType.TEXT_PLAIN.
        • Headers: Initialised to the empty collection of headers.
        • Query parameters: Initialised to the empty collection of query parameters.
        • Route parameters: Initialised to the empty collection of route parameters.
        Parameters:
        method - The HTTP method to use for a request. Cannot be null.
        url - The URL to use for a request. Cannot be null.
        body - The body to use for a request. Cannot be null.

        public void setContentType(org.apache.http.entity.ContentType contentType)

        Parameters:

        public void addRouteParam(String name,

        Parameters:
        name - A non-null name for the new query parameter
        value - A non-null value for the new query parameter

      • setBody

        public void setBody(Object body)
        Sets the body content that will be sent by a request. You cannot set the body to null; instead, if you don't want to send any body content, pass in the EMPTY_BODY constant.
        Parameters:
        body - A non-null string to send as the body content

        public Optional<org.apache.http.entity.ContentType> contentType()
        See HttpRequest.contentType() for information about this method.
        Returns:
        The content-type header, inside an Optional container to use for a request. An empty optional is returned if no content type was set.
